Charity donation app

My role

UX/UI Designer

Responsibilities
Wireframing
UI designing
Timeline

Approx. 1 month - June 2022

Platform

Mobile

Tools

Overview

Introduction
  • Chado is a technology platform that supports direct fundraising and helps users to know who is around you in difficulty
  • Where individuals and charities can start fundraising campaigns.
  • Covers many different areas from health, animal welfare, education to facility support.
  • Together, we can make a difference to at least one unfortunate person.
Value Proposition
Transparency

All donations are publicly visible

Verifed

All charities and campaigns are verified

Safety

Encrypted campaigns for your safety

Society

Spread kindness via social media

Challenge

At the beginning of 2021, the keyword “charity” was one of the hottest search terms in Vietnam. Many vietnamese popular comedians have been criticized by the public after they called for donations for flood victims last October but failed to transfer the donations . And the unclear and transparent statements and donation process have sparked a movement of people who doubt about these seemingly meaningful actions. To solve this problem, we created this app.

Problem
  • They are rather vague about the organization's campaign transparency.
  • They’re not sure if the money from charitable donations could reach to the right people, in the right place.
  • They don't have much time to go to the charity headquarters.
  • Difficulty in finding disadvantaged people around the living area.
Solution
  • Show transparent, clear information of the organization.
  • Easily search, check the results of the charity campaign
  • Optimize the charity donation process quickly and easily
  • Support those in need around the area as quickly as possible
Design Process

To work on this project, we took the Design Thinking framework as a basis. It’s a non-linear, iterative, process that we used to understand users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions to prototype and test.

The main advantages of this process are that is allows us to accurately define our user, their task and environments, involving user in design and development, feedback from user during design.

Empathy (1/5)

Market Research

To get an overview of this field, we have conducted market research based on available data. After referring to the scientific research, "People's perception of charity activities", we have extracted some relevant data as follows:

❮ ❯

Here are some of the significant data that were re-statisticed:

30-78
Age of people interested in charity
80%
of people have donated to charity in recent years
80%
of people who regularly donate and support are business people and traders
81%
of people who think that philanthropy is very important for the development of the community and the country.
75%
of people were informed about cases of need for assistance through loudspeakers, radio or television.

In addition, charity topics that users are often interested in: helping the poor, disaster relief, disability support, study promotion, raising disadvantaged children, environmental protection, blood donation, free medical treatment, accident emergency.

High Competitor Research

For competitor research, we want to focus on:

  1. See how they solve problems for users
  2. Exploit your opponent's strengths to promote
  3. Find out weaknesses that competitors have to avoid using in the design

With the above criteria, we have selected 2 applications to conduct research: sharethemeal.com and deeda.care

User Survey

With the limited data available that we have collected, it is difficult for us to envision the user audience we are targeting. So we conducted a survey of 52 people focusing on:

  1. Understanding how people donate
  2. Understanding their feelings and what makes them frustrated?
  3. What can meet their needs of donation?

Here are the survey results

❮ ❯

And here are the key data that we can summarize:

1-5
times is how often users donate in 1 year
72%
of people are quite reserved with donations
70%
of people donate through intermediaries and the rest want to do directly
81%
of people donate money and the rest donate clothes, food, other
75%
of people want to check information related to the organization, the intermediary, the victims and the purpose of using the donation
User Interview

Tôi đã tiến hành phỏng vấn 6 người thường tham gia quyên góp và xây dừng bảng thấu cảm để hiểu được những nhu cầu thật sự của họ

Objective

  • Hình dung được chân dung người dùng
  • Tiến trình + trải nghiệm mà người dùng đã làm để đạt được mục đích
  • Những trở ngại mà họ gặp phải
  • Những nhu cầu mà họ mong muốn đạt được
